00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup EXTI_Private_Define EXTI private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 /* EXTI EVWUPIEN mask                                                                                       */
00046 #define WAKUPCR_EVWUPIEN_SET      ((u32)0x80000000)
00047 #define WAKUPCR_EVWUPIEN_RESET    ((u32)0x7FFFFFFF)
00048 
00049 #if (LIBCFG_EXTI_8CH)
00050   const IRQn_Type gEXTIn_IRQn[16] = {
00051     EXTI0_IRQn, EXTI1_IRQn, EXTI2_IRQn, EXTI3_IRQn,
00052     EXTI4_IRQn, EXTI5_IRQn, EXTI6_IRQn, EXTI7_IRQn,
00053     EXTI0_IRQn, EXTI1_IRQn, EXTI2_IRQn, EXTI3_IRQn,
00054     EXTI4_IRQn, EXTI5_IRQn, EXTI6_IRQn, EXTI7_IRQn,
00055   };

00059     EXTI4_IRQn, EXTI5_IRQn, EXTI6_IRQn, EXTI7_IRQn,

00069 /** @defgroup EXTI_Exported_Functions EXTI exported functions
00070   * @{
00071   */
00072 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00073  * @brief Deinitialize the EXTI peripheral registers.
00074  * @param EXTI_Channel: can be 0, 1 to 15 to select the EXTI Channel.
00075  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00076  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00077  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00078  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00079  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00080  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00081  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00082  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00083  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00084  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00085  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00086  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00087  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00088  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00089  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00090  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00091  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00092  * @retval None
00093  ************************************************************************************************************/
00094 void EXTI_DeInit(u32 EXTI_Channel)
00095 {
00096   u32 tmp;
00097 
00098   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00099   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00100 
00101   tmp = 1 << EXTI_Channel;
00102 
00103   *((u32 *) HT_EXTI + EXTI_Channel) = 0x0;
00104   HT_EXTI->CR &= (~tmp);
00105   HT_EXTI->EDGEFLGR = tmp;
00106   HT_EXTI->EDGESR = tmp;
00107   HT_EXTI->SSCR &= (~tmp);
00108   HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR &= (~tmp);
00109   HT_EXTI->WAKUPPOLR &= (~tmp);
00110   HT_EXTI->WAKUPFLG = tmp;
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00114  * @brief Initialize the EXTI peripheral.
00115  * @param EXTI_InitStruct: pointer to a EXTI_InitTypeDef structure.
00116  * @retval None
00117  ************************************************************************************************************/
00118 void EXTI_Init(EXTI_InitTypeDef* EXTI_InitStruct)
00119 {
00120   u32 regval;
00121 
00122   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00123   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_Channel));
00124   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_DEBOUNCE_TYPE(EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_Debounce));
00125   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_DEBOUNCE_SIZE(EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_DebounceCnt));
00126   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_INT_TYPE(EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_IntType));
00127 
00128   /* Set EXTI interrupt configuration                                                                       */
00129   regval = (EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_Debounce << 31) | (EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_IntType << 28) | (EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_DebounceCnt);
00130   *((u32 *) HT_EXTI + EXTI_InitStruct->EXTI_Channel) = regval;
00131 }
00132 
00133 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00134  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified EXTI channelx interrupts.
00135  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00136  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00137  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00138  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00139  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00140  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00141  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00142  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00143  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00144  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00145  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00146  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00147  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00148  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00149  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00150  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00151  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00152  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00153  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00154  * @retval None
00155  ************************************************************************************************************/
00156 void EXTI_IntConfig(u32 EXTI_Channel, ControlStatus NewState)
00157 {
00158   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00159   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00160   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00161 
00162   /* Configure EXTI interrupt                                                                               */
00163   if (NewState == ENABLE)
00164   {
00165     HT_EXTI->CR |= (1 << EXTI_Channel);
00166   }
00167   else
00168   {
00169     HT_EXTI->CR &= ~(1 << EXTI_Channel);
00170   }
00171 }
00172 
00173 #if (LIBCFG_EXTI_DEBCNTPRE)
00174 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00175  * @brief Configure the Debounce Counter prescaler.
00176  * @param EXTI_DebCntPre_DIVn: specify the prescaler value.
00177  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00178  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV1    : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 1
00179  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV2    : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 2
00180  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV4    : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 4
00181  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV8    : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 8
00182  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV16   : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 16
00183  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV32   : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 32
00184  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV64   : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 64
00185  *     @arg EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIV128  : CK_DBCNT = EXTI_PCLK / 128
00186  * @retval None
00187  ************************************************************************************************************/
00188 void EXTI_SetDebounceCounterPrescaler(EXTI_DebCntPre_TypeDef EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIVn)
00189 {
00190   /* Check the parameters */
00191   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_DEBOUNCE_COUNTER_PRESCALER(EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIVn));
00192 
00193   HT_EXTI->CFGR0 = ((HT_EXTI->CFGR0 & 0xF8FFFFFF) | (EXTI_DBCNTPRE_DIVn << 24));
00194 }
00195 #endif
00196 
00197 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00198  * @brief Configure the EXTI channelx event wakeup function.
00199  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00200  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00201  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00202  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00203  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00204  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00205  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00206  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00207  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00208  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00209  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00210  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00211  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00212  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00213  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00214  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00215  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00216  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00217  * @param EXTI_WakeUpType: determines the type of signal to trigger EXTI interrupt.
00218  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00219  *     @arg EXTI_WAKEUP_HIGH_LEVEL
00220  *     @arg EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL
00221  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00222  * @retval None
00223  ************************************************************************************************************/
00224 void EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(u32 EXTI_Channel, u8 EXTI_WakeUpType, ControlStatus NewState)
00225 {
00226   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00227   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00228   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_WAKEUP_TYPE(EXTI_WakeUpType));
00229   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00230 
00231   if (NewState == ENABLE)
00232   {
00233     if (EXTI_WakeUpType == EXTI_WAKEUP_HIGH_LEVEL)
00234     {
00235       HT_EXTI->WAKUPPOLR &= ~(1 << EXTI_Channel);
00236     }
00237     else
00238     {
00239       HT_EXTI->WAKUPPOLR |= (1 << EXTI_Channel);
00240     }
00241 
00242     HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR |=  (1 << EXTI_Channel);
00243   }
00244   else
00245   {
00246     HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR &= ~(1 << EXTI_Channel);
00247   }
00248 }
00249 
00250 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00251  * @brief Enable or Disable the EXTI channelx event wakeup interrupt.
00252  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00253  * @retval None
00254  ************************************************************************************************************/
00255 void EXTI_WakeupEventIntConfig(ControlStatus NewState)
00256 {
00257   if (NewState == ENABLE)
00258   {
00259     /* Set EVWUPIEN bit                                                                                     */
00260     HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR |= WAKUPCR_EVWUPIEN_SET;
00261   }
00262   else
00263   {
00264     /* Clear EVWUPIEN bit                                                                                   */
00265     HT_EXTI->WAKUPCR &= WAKUPCR_EVWUPIEN_RESET;
00266   }
00267 }
00268 
00269 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00270  * @brief Clear the specified EXTI channelx edge flag.
00271  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00272  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00273  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00274  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00275  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00276  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00277  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00278  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00279  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00280  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00281  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00282  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00283  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00284  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00285  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00286  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00287  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00288  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00289  * @retval None
00290  ************************************************************************************************************/
00291 void EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(u32 EXTI_Channel)
00292 {
00293   u32 tmp;
00294 
00295   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00296   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00297 
00298   tmp = 1 << EXTI_Channel;
00299 
00300   /* Write 1 to clear both edge detection flag                                                              */
00301   HT_EXTI->EDGEFLGR = tmp;
00302   /* Write 1 to clear positive edge detection flag                                                          */
00303   HT_EXTI->EDGESR = tmp;
00304 }
00305 
00306 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00307  * @brief Clear the specified EXTI channelx wakeup flag.
00308  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00309  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00310  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00311  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00312  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00313  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00314  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00315  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00316  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00317  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00318  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00319  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00320  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00321  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00322  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00323  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00324  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00325  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00326  * @retval None
00327  ************************************************************************************************************/
00328 void EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(u32 EXTI_Channel)
00329 {
00330   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00331   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00332 
00333   /* Write 1 to clear wake up flag                                                                          */
00334   HT_EXTI->WAKUPFLG = 1 << EXTI_Channel;
00335 
00336   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00337   /* DSB instruction is added in this function to ensure the write operation which is for clearing interrupt*/
00338   /* flag is actually completed before exiting ISR. It prevents the NVIC from detecting the interrupt again */
00339   /* since the write register operation may be pended in the internal write buffer of Cortex-Mx when program*/
00340   /* has exited interrupt routine. This DSB instruction may be masked if this function is called in the     */
00341   /* beginning of ISR and there are still some instructions before exiting ISR.                             */
00342   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00343   __DSB();
00344 }
00345 
00346 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00347  * @brief Get the specified EXTI channelx edge flag.
00348  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00349  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00350  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00351  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00352  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00353  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00354  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00355  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00356  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00357  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00358  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00359  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00360  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00361  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00362  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00363  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00364  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00365  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00366  * @retval SET or RESET
00367  ************************************************************************************************************/
00368 FlagStatus EXTI_GetEdgeFlag(u32 EXTI_Channel)
00369 {
00370   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00371   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00372 
00373   return ((HT_EXTI->EDGEFLGR & (1UL << EXTI_Channel)) ? SET : RESET);
00374 }
00375 
00376 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00377  * @brief Get the specified EXTI channelx edge status.
00378  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00379  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00380  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00381  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00382  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00383  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00384  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00385  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00386  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00387  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00388  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00389  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00390  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00391  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00392  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00393  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00394  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00395  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00396  * @param EXTI_Edge: can be status of edge that user want to monitor.
00397  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00398  *     @arg EXTI_EDGE_POSITIVE
00399  *     @arg EXTI_EDGE_NEGATIVE
00400  * @retval SET or RESET
00401  ************************************************************************************************************/
00402 FlagStatus EXTI_GetEdgeStatus(u32 EXTI_Channel, u32 EXTI_Edge)
00403 {
00404   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00405   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00406   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_EDGE(EXTI_Edge));
00407 
00408   if (HT_EXTI->EDGEFLGR & (1UL << EXTI_Channel))
00409   {
00410     if (GetBit_BB((u32)&HT_EXTI->EDGESR, EXTI_Channel) ^ EXTI_Edge)
00411     {
00412       return SET;
00413     }
00414     else
00415     {
00416       return RESET;
00417     }
00418   }
00419   else
00420   {
00421     return RESET;
00422   }
00423 }
00424 
00425 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00426  * @brief Get the specified EXTI channelx wakeup flag.
00427  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00428  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00429  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00430  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00431  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00432  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00433  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00434  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00435  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00436  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00437  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00438  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00439  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00440  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00441  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00442  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00443  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00444  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00445  * @retval SET or RESET
00446  ************************************************************************************************************/
00447 FlagStatus EXTI_GetWakeupFlagStatus(u32 EXTI_Channel)
00448 {
00449   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00450   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00451 
00452   if (HT_EXTI->WAKUPFLG & (1 << EXTI_Channel))
00453   {
00454     return SET;
00455   }
00456   else
00457   {
00458     return RESET;
00459   }
00460 }
00461 
00462 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00463  * @brief Activate or Deactivate an EXTI channelx interrupt by software.
00464  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00465  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00466  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00467  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00468  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00469  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00470  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00471  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00472  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00473  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00474  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00475  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00476  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00477  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00478  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00479  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00480  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00481  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00482  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00483  * @retval None
00484  ************************************************************************************************************/
00485 void EXTI_SWIntCmd(u32 EXTI_Channel, ControlStatus NewState)
00486 {
00487   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00488   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00489   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00490 
00491   if (NewState == ENABLE)
00492   {
00493     HT_EXTI->SSCR = 1 << EXTI_Channel;
00494   }
00495   else
00496   {
00497     HT_EXTI->SSCR &= ~(1 << EXTI_Channel);
00498   }
00499 }
00500 
00501 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00502  * @brief Get the specified EXTI channelx software command register bit.
00503  * @param EXTI_Channel: specify the EXTI channel.
00504  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00505  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_0
00506  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_1
00507  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_2
00508  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_3
00509  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_4
00510  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_5
00511  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_6
00512  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_7
00513  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_8
00514  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_9
00515  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_10
00516  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_11
00517  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_12
00518  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_13
00519  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_14
00520  *     @arg EXTI_CHANNEL_15
00521  * @retval SET or RESET
00522  ************************************************************************************************************/
00523 FlagStatus EXTI_GetSWCmdStatus(u32 EXTI_Channel)
00524 {
00525   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00526   Assert_Param(IS_EXTI_CHANNEL(EXTI_Channel));
00527 
00528   if (HT_EXTI->SSCR & (1 << EXTI_Channel))
00529   {
00530     return SET;
00531   }
00532   else
00533   {
00534     return RESET;
00535   }
00536 }
